page.title: 13Longridge Fell - Flora
page.content:
The fell is of millstone grit, with limestone outcropping in the valley on the north side, around Arbour Farm.
"Arbour Quarry" now disused is a designated nature reserve, noted for its limestone flora, contrasting with that of the acid soils of the fell above, with its typically meagre gritstone flora, which includes a number of calcifuges; gorse, foxglove, and heath bedstraw. There are also herebell, bilberry, bramble, cranberry, heath, cotton grass and ling.
Recent attempts to improve the land around Cardwell House have had little success. Other roadside plants include Willowherb, bindweed, sneezewort, yarrow, hawkbits, campion and ragged robbin.
